result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Isaiah Cortez Bernard not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Isaiah Cortez Bernard.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Bastien is requesting jury trial date of 11-14-22 be vacated to have time to go over the file.  Jury trial on 11-14-22 is vacated.  Case is adjourend to 11-8-22 at 8:30 am for a status conference/ bail review.

Defendant Isaiah Cortez Bernard not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Isaiah Cortez Bernard.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense's Bail Hearing held.  Arguments heard.  Additional statements by LS and RL.  For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIES bail motion.  Case remains calendared for Plea and Sentencing Hearing on 9/9/2022 at Courthouse Room 504.
from Ronald Laura, filed.
At the request of the defense, case is scheduled for a bail review on 8-29-22 at 8:30 am.  Partis agreed upon court date via email.
Received and Filed. Motion To Modify Bail

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Isaiah Cortez Bernard not in court, in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 9-9-22 at 2:00 pm for sentencing in person in room Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Isaiah Cortez Bernard not in court, in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel needs global offer to include new case and requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR.10
Defendant Isaiah Cortez Bernard in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant Isaiah Cortez Bernard in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to case 21CF4811 & 21CF2714.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J.Heritz.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with RL & Family; LS
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn (off the record).  Recall issued.
MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling.  Defendant at MSDF.

Defendant Isaiah Cortez Bernard in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Isaiah Cortez Bernard in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Isaiah Cortez Bernard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
